name: Blob
description: A Blob object represents a file-like object of immutable, raw data. Blobs represent data that isn't necessarily in a JavaScript-native format. The File interface is based on Blob, inheriting blob functionality and expanding it to support files on the user's system.

members.name: Blob(blobParts[, options])
members.description: Returns a newly created Blob object whose content consists of the concatenation of the array of values given in parameter.

members.name: Blob.size
members.description: The size, in bytes, of the data contained in the Blob object.

members.name: Blob.type
members.description: A string indicating the MIMEÂ type of the data contained in the Blob. If the type is unknown, this string is empty.

members.name: Blob.slice([start[, end[, contentType]]])
members.description: Returns a new Blob object containing the data in the specified range of bytes of the source Blob.

parameters.name: start Optional
parameters.description: An index into the Blob indicating the first byte to include in the new Blob. If you specify a negative value, it's treated as an offset from the end of the string toward the beginning. For example, -10 would be the 10th from last byte in the Blob. The default value is 0. If you specify a value for start that is larger than the size of the source Blob, the returned Blob has size 0 and contains no data.

parameters.name: end Optional
parameters.description: An index into the Blob indicating the first byte that will *not* be included in the new Blob (i.e. the byte exactly at this index is not included). If you specify a negative value, it's treated as an offset from the end of the string toward the beginning. For example, -10 would be the 10th from last byte in the Blob. The default value is size.

parameters.name: contentType Optional
parameters.description: The content type to assign to the new Blob; this will be the value of its type property. The default value is an empty string.
